title: Leap-of-Thought (LoT)

definitions.Chain-of-Thought (CoT): CoT guides MLLM to reason step-by-step, and can motivate their logical reasoning ability. While effective for logical tasks, CoT is not conducive to creative problem-solving which often requires out-of-box thoughts and is crucial for innovation advancements.

summary: The slide discusses the concept of Chain-of-Thought (CoT) and Leap-of-Thought (LoT) in the context of Large Language Models (LLLM). CoT is described as a step-by-step reasoning process that is effective for logical tasks but not for creative problem-solving. LoT is presented as a non-sequential, creative paradigm that involves strong associations and knowledge leaps, which is crucial for innovation advancements.
